chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristen Mary Sauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State by Diaz (Tremp Co)) in person /  Def in custody in LCJ by video w/ Atty Geraldson in person
CRT:  this is set for plea
Def:  I want to get out.  I know there were some things that were agreed to
Diaz:  it was my understanding that as of yesterday & this morning, the matter was resolved.  I met w/ Mr Geraldson today & he stated def was not agreeing to terms of resolution
CRT:  I do not accept a No Contest plea unless there is an issue w/ restitution
11:09 Case Recalled - Atty Geraldson appears & CRT updates Atty Geraldson
Geraldson:  I was given offer yesterday from DA Sacia, she denies the charge of criminal damage...I have not had time to discuss a new resolution w/ other parties
Diaz:  resolution was from May.  Technologies not working as we like, comments on logistics & incorporating agreement into a settlement.  It is my understanding Geraldson will be contacting Sacia this afternoon
Geraldson comments on bond
Diaz:  given her history including BJ & history of not making appearances, she should remain in custody  - agreement is not for additional jail time
Geraldson:  req Sig bond due to amt of time def has been sitting, while released she maintained good communication w/ me, I am not aware of history of missing CRT
CRT:  Looking over prelim report, there were 5 missed appearances & 2 of them were in Feb.  There are 3 felony cases in Monroe Co.  If cases are not resolved by Mon., CRT will relook at bond
CRT:  Bond to remain as is
CRT:  Plea Hrg:  8-1-2022 @ 2:30 - Def to appear in person

State by Diaz (from Tremp Co) by video /  Def in custody in LCJ by video w/ Atty Geraldson by video
Diaz:  I rec'd message from ADA Sacia that there are some work that needs to be done on resolving issues.  Sacia made request to adjourn for a week or 2 so we could work w/ Geraldson
Geraldson:  nothing has been done for over a month.  DA did not appear for bond Hrg.  Minutes were sent to Mr Sacia indicating time lines for offer/diversion, I believe work needed to be done a week prior to Hrg & nothing has been done
CRT:  I kept Ms Sauer in jail so she would be here today & not incur new charges - I am concerned w/ progress of case
CRT:  Plea Hrg: 7-28-2022 @ 11am (this will overlap a couple of Hrgs).  If this is not resolved, CRT will dismiss case for lack of prosecution.  CRT will recycle zoom info
Plea hearing on July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
